website_summaries.verdict: This solid audio interface is simple, affordable, and very effective at what it does.
pros: Good audio quality that minimizes hissing
Features include transformer isolation, balanced outputs, and a stereo/mono switch
cons: Doesn't come with a USB cable
Some buyers say this option makes too much random noise

customer_reviews.title: SInce Peavey doesn't see fit to give any specification on ...
customer_reviews.text: SInce Peavey doesn't see fit to give any specification on the DAC, I popped mine open to see what was inside. The heavy lifting is done by a Texas Instruments PCM2705, with an SNR of 98db, sample rates of 32, 44.4, and 48 kHz. This is an older USB 1.1 complaint device and has since been replaced by the PCM2705C with USB 2 compliance. The device itself works perfectly for connecting studio monitors to my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great DAC!
customer_reviews.text: I was having some trouble with my studio monitors (speakers). I kept getting a hissing sound I tried different cables but the sound was still there. I looked into it and found out I needed an interface. So I did some research and came across this DAC. The price was reasonable and so I went for it. This is a great DAC. Got rid of my problem. and looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Mig A.

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit, no more hiss, clear sound
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Feels very quality -No more hiss from my studio monitors being plugged in to the line out of my motherboard -SOUNDS SO CLEAR! -Small enough to fit on my desktop -Simple plug and play design (no drivers, software...) Cons: -Doesn't come with a USB cable For me, not having a cable was not a big deal. I've got plenty of those dudes laying around. But if you are going to order this, be sure to get a cable with it if you don't have one!
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I needed an interface out of my laptop for live purposes. The audio quality is great and sound guys love only having to deal with an XLR. This is affordable, solidly built, and just works. Not much else to say. I run the novation launchkey25 into my laptop which is running logic X. Ditch the laptop headphone port and achieve full digital glory using this!
customer_reviews.author: Terassic

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play. Works exactly how it should. Simply connect to a USB port and then connect XLR cord(s) to your mixer and turn up the volume. I love that I have the choice to run mono to the mixer so I do not have to dedicate 2 channels for a stereo mix if I really do not need stereo effects. So much easier and cheaper than anything else I've found to connect a computer to an analog mixer that does not have a USB input option.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Solved Interference Issue, Upgraded Sound Quality!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, WOW. I didn't know that my KRK Rokit 5 monitors could sound this good. I'm extremely impressed with this DAC and will be recommending it to anyone who needs a similar solution. I bought this initially because I was experiencing awful interference from my PC. Whenever I'd move my mouse, or there was heavy processor activity I would notice a terrible scratchy sound coming from my speakers. Not only did my problem get solved, but the audio quality increase I got is insane. A+ to Peavey for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thayer

customer_reviews.title: You found it
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a cheap way to play audio on your speakers without any hiss this is absolutely it. I have tried many options and this is by far the best. To explain how great this is, let me mention that I often switch between computers with a KVM switch. This means that I can press a button and have all my peripherals including my mouse, keyboard, and Peavey DAC switch which computer they can have input from. When playing music on both computers, I can switch between them without the audio skipping a beat, no setup required. No driver necessary. This is it!
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Sena

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality and Durability
customer_reviews.text: Sorry this review is so late but I am very disappointed in this product, especially since I am a big fan and owner of other products. This product caused a loud hum in my audio setup, so I removed it at once. It has been sitting on a bench in my studio since the day I purchased it. I just have not found the time to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Rugged simple design, does its job well. Slight humming if too close to other equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I connected this box using balanced xlr and noticed a bit of humming. Upon going to test the cables I picked up the box and the noise stopped. It was receiving interference from the rest of my gear. Moving the cables had no effect, it was only proximity of the Peavey to the rest of my gear. At only a foot away the noise stopped. I can live with that compromise. Sound quality is great, no noticeable quality difference between this and my Scarlett 2i2.
customer_reviews.author: Zach G

customer_reviews.title: Thank You Peavey!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get audio backing tracks out of a laptop into our sound reinforcement system at church. It is an elegant and simple design that works flawlessly for it's intended purpose. Plug it into the laptop via USB, set your DAW's output to it's channels and set your gain at the board. Very simple and works fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Amazing piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: This thing is WONDERFUL. No more noisy cables and silly connections to computer. Great piece of gear. Kudos to Peavey.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Guitar

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Being just an D to A output only, I would expect the sound quality to be exceptional. And it was. My only grieving point, was that it is only 16 bit output. But still it is a very practical product and should work well in most scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Helpful audio tool. Worth keeping in your workbox.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this unit many times with other Video Technicians to extract audio from a computer source and send the audio to the Audio Engineer at front of house. Best part is, it works on both Apple and Windows devices. Needed it on a gig recently and had to finally buy my own. Super handy to have and without the stupid 60 cycle hum you get from DI's and PCDI's.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel V.

customer_reviews.title: Fixes computer noises coming through headphone jack into studio monitors.
customer_reviews.text: The Peavey USB-P solved my problem of hearing computer and hard drive noises coming through the 3.5mm headphone jack into my powered studio monitors using a 3.5mm to TRS cable. I now go from USB to XLR into my monitors (JBL LSR 305+310S). Excellent solution that nobody has recommended to me on any forum I've been on.
customer_reviews.author: Terence P

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I used this interface to connect my powered studio monitors to my PC. This item is very simple to use. The sound is more clear with this item because prior to using it I was getting a low level humming when no sound was coming through the monitors. This product completely eliminated the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Barretta

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this to interface my computer to my PA system. It's about as simple as can be - no drivers to install or anything like that. My only minor complaint is that the USB port is on one side and the XLR outputs are on the other. I would rather have all the ports on the one side to make cable management and situating the device easier. Otherwise, the device works great.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I've used it for multiple laptops Windows 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I've used it for multiple laptops Windows 7 & Windows 10 to play prerecorded music through a PA system. Very easy to use, connect the USB cable, wait a couple of seconds while the inherent Windows driver loads and the PC is ready to play through the XLR outputs. Why buy a more expensive solution which uses proprietary drivers?
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little interface!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things! For years I've been listening to the annoying interference on my KRK monitors due to running an unbalanced input (ie. 1/8 stereo to rca from the onboard sound card in my computer) and now the interference has completely gone away with this little DAC. Windows 10 detected the DAC within 5 seconds and I was good to go. Super awesome piece of hardware!
customer_reviews.author: Blueaksss

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, just love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this in the other day and it's just the best thing. Coupled with my EQ I can swap between my laptops or desktop via the USB cable. I opened it up and it uses a TI BB PCM2705 DAC. The current setup is this guy, 30-band two-channel EQ, Fostex PMO.4n. The clarity, response, noise floor, and sonic response is substantially improved over any OEM audio interface.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Sopko

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with a great price
customer_reviews.text: It worked as described. So far, no latency or sound quality problems. I use it in church to connect a MacBook Pro running Mainstage in stereo. I was going to buy a Scarlett interface and 2 direct boxes, but this do the job and saved me around $400!
customer_reviews.author: William Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have some old Behringer Studio monitors that I love, but could never connect to my computer without some soft of interference or humming sound. But this little guy eliminates all interference and now I can fully enjoy the accurate sound when mixing for videos! Inexpensive and highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: RJP

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box with Ubuntu Linux 17.10 and 18.04 LTS
customer_reviews.text: We're using two of these for our podcast. Works out of the box with Ubuntu Linux 17.10 and 18.04 LTS. PulseAudio identifies the device as PCM2705. We did have to run the signal through a preamp but that was expected. Does a good job eliminating 60Hz USB hum. Pros: Well construed. Mono & stereo switch. Eliminates 60Hz USB hum No additional configuration needed under Linux. Cons: Low output volume.
customer_reviews.author: LinuxGameCast

customer_reviews.title: The best solution for playing PC sound files through a mixer
customer_reviews.text: This does one thing and it does it very well. Plug it in and it works. It's probably not audiophile grade, but it sounds great and is infinitely better than using a 1/8" plug and adapters . I was using a Radial JPC before. The JPC is a really high-quality direct box, but it can't help you with noise that comes out of your sound card, or with those unreliable 1/8" audio jacks. This thing lets you go straight to the mixer with balanced outputs.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Weston

customer_reviews.title: Make sure this is what you want.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as advertised for my setup. Returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great simple box for quick USB DI
customer_reviews.text: My band used this on tour for a low-cost, low-maintenance MIDI/laptop setup, and it worked great every time. Simple solution to be able to bring a cheap keys rig on tour. I was very happy to find that this sort of box existed. It made each sound-guy's job super easy. One XLR cable (for mono, or two for stereo) and he had our keys in the system.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Mozdzanowski

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, Great price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to run Ableton Live and to split my tracks to one channel and my click and cues to another channel. Very easy to plug in and go. Small enough to store in a backpack so it is great for any gig!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Works, Sounds Good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for our control room. We had been using a DI box to get sound from our computer to an audio mix, but the floor noise was horrible. Now we get good sound with a very low floor :)
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: does it's job
customer_reviews.text: unit runs well well, sound quality is fine. a little more reliable than headphone to xlr adapters, and can be used in conjunction with your headphone out to play multiple unique sources at once. i've used this for ableton triggered playback while my headphone out runs spotify and my little focusrite handles smaart, all playing together nicely live.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, literally plug and play. It sounds excellent and is built like a tank. I have had zero issues with it since day one - mine has been working flawlessly for 3 years now.
customer_reviews.author: p-rose

customer_reviews.title: its a good product other than the usb does not fit tightly ...
customer_reviews.text: its a good product other than the usb does not fit tightly into this audio interface its very easy to unplug. packaging was damaged as well but no big deal......overall good product
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Little

customer_reviews.title: Great find sovled a lot of issues including ground loop and hum
customer_reviews.text: Peavey you have a hidden hit here! This product requires no drivers in Widows 10. Other products require driver that Windows 10 updates often overwrites the drivers rendering it useless. Nothing else like it at this price on the market. Technicality it works great, no noise and EQ is flat 20hz to 20khz.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Stone

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Unit
customer_reviews.text: This little guy really works. I got rid of the annoying Humming and Buzzing Sounds coming from my audio system.It's got a mono/stereo switch in the front. It also really easy to use just "plug and play", no need for drivers. I recommend this unit to anybody who's trying to run back tracks from their laptops into their church PA system. It's a must have.
customer_reviews.author: JULIO

customer_reviews.title: Great product, minor flaw in design
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 5 star review but the usb input is on the opposite side of the outputs which is a pain to cable manage. I would recommend searching for a similar product with all I/O on one side
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: do not buy  this  junk
customer_reviews.text: does not last. have not even used yet. went to use and does not work. the usb on unit does not lock in good. so no green light. no work. sorry I got this junk. save your money. way to go peavey.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best Option
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Yamaha studio monitors, makes it really easy to run through a PC, sounds great
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Avallone

customer_reviews.title: Driver was not free
customer_reviews.text: It cost as much as the Peavy piece if memory serves. If the driver was free I probably would still have it....
customer_reviews.author: Dawnrazor

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Rugged and heavy duty enclosure. Works great to keep in your back pack and work box.
customer_reviews.author: William Matschukat

customer_reviews.title: Solid no-frills option for USB Audio Interface
customer_reviews.text: No bells or whistles except for the mono/stereo switch which is important. I would love a gain control like the Radial USB-Pro (4X the price) but I can't complain. Works well and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTX

customer_reviews.title: Solid, functional unit
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Built well. I use this, along with a powered usb hub, to connect my iphone to the sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Audio output is too low. I needed this to ...
customer_reviews.text: Audio output is too low. I needed this to connect a pair of studio monitors to a computer and although it worked and the speakers where semi loud the output was 1/4 that of the Sound Blaster USB sound card I replaced it with.
customer_reviews.author: Chris MacClellan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Working well to get audio from our iMac into a digital mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Q-Lab
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this interface to pair with Q-Lab and it did a fabulous job. It had no problem recognizing the interface and made it a lot easier to assign tracks with much better sounding audio.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Runion

customer_reviews.text: Along with XLR cables, I got this for a pair of JBL LSR 305s. It works perfectly couldn't be more happy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Red Casper

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for my application
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what i needed to connect my iMac to my JBL LSR308's. I had used a headphone jack cable but i heard lots of interference with my bluetooth devices. Using professional balanced XLR cables with this box from Peavey did the trick. It sounds so much better.
customer_reviews.author: John Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect as a cheap interface for my XLR speakers
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect as a cheap interface for my XLR speakers. However I wish it had more to it such as volume control or at least a nicer looking frame. Otherwise great item.
customer_reviews.author: J. Legaspi

customer_reviews.title: 10th one
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great solution or the need to get balanced stereo audio out of the Ish port of computer
customer_reviews.author: Stickymuse

customer_reviews.title: Best sound quality you may find with this anything less ...
customer_reviews.text: Best sound quality you may find with this anything less than $100. Attention, outputs are low impedance line signals. It's not a product for HiFi applications. It's for audio recordings.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Y

customer_reviews.title: I bought a few of these to take audio out ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these to take audio out from laptops into our audio mixers and they work perfectly
customer_reviews.author: James Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great way to stop using your headphone out
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what i needed it to. i have always hatted using the headphone jack when connecting to a sound system. This eliminates that problem. Extremely simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brockway

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit, actually noticeably improved the audio coming out of my studio monitors which I wasn't really expecting. Cheap yet high quality interface. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Riley P Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Introduces hum
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last summer for a project that I didn't get to work on until recently. Unfortunately when I got everything hooked up the system had severe hum. After hours of troubleshooting it turns out the USB-P was the source. Now its off to search for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stopped the random noise coming out of my studio monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the unbalanced outpost of your standard pc
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Worked just for what i needed. Was getting a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked just for what i needed. Was getting a hum from using aux to xlr . Used this and took the hum out
customer_reviews.author: christian galindo

customer_reviews.title: This device is a hidden gem!
customer_reviews.text: American made, good to see an American company actually make something in USA! Dead silent, my previous DAC I purchased had slight 60HZ hum, that's why I bought this one. Very pleased with performance, sounds great! Be sure and pick up an XLR to RCA cable for your input to your home stereo, that's probably why it's dead silent. Sound quality of internal sound cards in computers is always poor in my opinion, this sounds demonstrably better!
customer_reviews.author: davec

customer_reviews.title: clear, loud, small, ya
customer_reviews.text: omg so ideal. fantastic sound quality. does its one job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle4Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for using a laptop live
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I needed it for, and does it well. I use a midi controller connected to my macbook running Mainstage, with the sound output going out of my usb into this interface, and from this interface straight to the main board via XLR. It feels solid, all connections are secure, and the sound quality is great. Mainstage even recognized it as soon as I plugged it in, and automatically prompted me to switch my audio output to the usb.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no complaints! Worked as great interface between my computer and the sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Giovanetto

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: USB-in one end, balanced line-out the other. Inexpensive, works fine, sounds much better than my sound card. There are much fancier audio interfaces, but this is all I really need.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Truher

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Pretty clean and reliable. I have used this on a few computers that have caused buzz even with the best standard DIs. This one kept them quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J.

customer_reviews.title: True plug and play. This Peavey USB Audio Interface ...
customer_reviews.text: True plug and play. This Peavey USB Audio Interface worked perfectly to connect my JBL LSR305 studio monitors to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Arvizo

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, Needs better quality
customer_reviews.text: Great concept and price, but tends to emit a low level hum.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson P Bryan

customer_reviews.title: ... issues straight out of the box - no more annoying this coming from my monitors
customer_reviews.text: Solved ground loop issues straight out of the box - no more annoying this coming from my monitors. Works perfectly. Only disappointment is no USB cable included.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Does exactly what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Really improves sound vs using your laptop headphone jack. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Does one thing and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: this great, reliable little single function device has earned a permanent place in my audio toolbox. The mono/stereo switch comes in handy too. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ryzabov

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Simple
customer_reviews.text: This device works perfectly. It works in seconds. I've used it on multiple occasions and even saved a show where the artist's focusrite interface was failing. I'm a big fan of the simplicity. It's very user-friendly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter McGinn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly... just plug and play. All I had to do was choose it as my main audio out.
customer_reviews.author: luv2cre8

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Made my highs super crisp and my lows thump. I will never run out of a mac or pc headphone jack into my sound board again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AWESOME! I use it for sending tracks with my ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! I use it for sending tracks with my band to the PA. Left is click and right is tracks. Works like a charm and there are no buttons on the device that will screw it up such as volume, pan, pad..etc
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Finley

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars! It's perfect for 2 channel playback in the studio. Awesome price too!
customer_reviews.author: Jon & Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best (cheapest) option to get XLR output from your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Yaport

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: Way, way, way better sound than using an RCA adapter out of the headphone jack. Like night and day. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Olewiler

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, capable
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's suppsoed to do. No muss, no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Gowing

customer_reviews.title: Special for dj's and portable computerized sound systems.
customer_reviews.text: Needed for my computer. Really simplifies connecting my computer to a sound mixer.
customer_reviews.author: SOUPY

customer_reviews.title: The best way to run computer audio to your sound board!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Literally, plug and play. No more hum. No more adapters or splitters.
customer_reviews.author: William Jones

customer_reviews.title: No noticeable lag, works fine for live performance.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a try for connecting my laptop to a PA system for live performances using a MIDI keyboard controlling a few software synths (Omnisphere primarily). I was concerned about USB-related latency and had been using a Zoom TAC-2, but that unit is way more than I need for this purpose. The Peavey adapter works great and I noticed no excessive lagging. This is a gem of a find.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work great and sound better than the standard analog (headphone) outputs on most laptop/desktop computers.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to get your audio from your computer to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to get your audio from your computer to a Professional Soundsystem. Only one question, why not shipping directly to the Netherlands?
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Setup Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: This product was super easy and super simple to setup, it was also super easy to use. When I got the product it took me no time at all to setup and get running. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simple and perfect. It just does what it has to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Unique Product
customer_reviews.text: This device reduces the need to use the 3.5 mm Laptop audio Out in favor of a more robust hook-up.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Simple Audio Solution for Connecting to Pro Gear
customer_reviews.text: I've bought five of these units so far for connecting computers to large venue sound systems and they work very well. Routing audio through this USB DI is a far better option than using the headphone output for various reasons. Headphone amps can hum and buzz, delivering pretty nasty sound as a result. Also, this unit gives you two XLR connections for left and right output (for mono + click or stereo), and is also switchable to mono if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Congleton

customer_reviews.title: Great audio for the money
customer_reviews.text: Must remember this is a playback only card. For the money you'll never find such a bargain. I work with professional sound cards valued at 10 to 20 times this much and this is the real deal. No "unbalanced" buzzes with this card. Audio level is not professional level but can be compensated for since it is so quiet. Did I mention BALANCED audio output! No drivers needed, at least with Windows7. A little more documentation from Peavey would be nice but it was totally plug and play. Have not plugged into XP to see hot that works. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great USB audio interface with XLR outputs
customer_reviews.text: Great USB audio interface with XLR outputs, really good sound quality and low noise. Volume adjustable from Windows / Mac OSX master volume control. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Martin Thu

customer_reviews.title: THE Solution
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. THE solution for anyone who wants to monitor balanced audio without the need to also input/record it.
customer_reviews.author: gjames80

customer_reviews.title: I love this product for playing my Hi-Fi music collection on ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product for playing my Hi-Fi music collection on my studio monitors. The TRS connector wasn't cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: buckets507

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a box that stopped working after only a month - after lots of research we chose this unit & we are very happy with it. We use it at our church for sound & media & everyone has been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: charity

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment. It solved the hum we were getting from our computer to PA system
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: I would like to see a version with some internal gain control
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as described, I would like to see a version with some internal gain control.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Banks

customer_reviews.title: great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Works on Windows and Ubuntu. Hopefully I'll never have to use the 3.5 jacks into loud speakers again
customer_reviews.author: hds

customer_reviews.title: Volume suffers.
customer_reviews.text: A little too passive for my purpose. The volume suffered so I returned it and bought one that boosts the volume more.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for the loud pop on shutdown.
customer_reviews.text: - no proprietary drivers: works with Linux and Mac - reasonably priced - low latency - low noise The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that when you power it off (e.g. by shutting down your computer or unplugging the USB cable), a low pop is usually sent to my studio monitors. Not only is this annoying; it can damage speakers over time. Thus, I have to remember to turn off my speakers before shutting down the computer.
customer_reviews.author: My Profile Name

customer_reviews.title: ... aliasing at high frequency that D/A converter should be better. Balanced output is good but transformer character too ...
customer_reviews.text: I hear aliasing at high frequency that D/A converter should be better. Balanced output is good but transformer character too strong. But overall You can't buy anything better in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Park

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad placement of ports...better all on 1 side...more options would be nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too bad it doesn't have some variable output control for that ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked, but not in the way I needed. I found the output to be too low to drive the amp I'm using to power some speakers out of the computer. The output is significantly lower in gain than the headphone out of many computers, so if you don't have a powerful enough amp to compensate for the low output, you might find as I did that this will result in too weak a signal for your system. Too bad it doesn't have some variable output control for that situation...
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Wayte
